repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Integrated Solar Combined Cycle
            Power Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Integrated Solar
            Combined Cycle Power Project for Morocco were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: the use of integrated solar-combined cycle (ISCC)
            technology can be a stepping stone for scaling-up
            concentrated solar power (CSP), provided that fossil fuel
            supply is guaranteed. ISCC plants offer a unique solution to
            build small capacity solar fields to substitute fossil fuel
            in larger conventional plants. The choice of an optimal site
            is a key to the development of an Integrated Solar Combined
            Cycle (ISCC) plant. Extend the operations and maintenance
            (O&M) period from two to five years. Suppliers of key
            ISCC plant components need to be members of the Engineering
            Procurement Construction (EPC) consortium. Encourage
            independent solar irradiation measurements in order to
            ensure a correct application of penalties. Plan the tender
            to satisfy both utility and bidder needs. Set mirror soiling
            goals and meet them by an appropriate frequency for mirror
            panel washing. Establish a framework of open partnership
            with the EPC contractor to resolve any potential incident as
            soon as possible.

7632856.trustfund:
TF058314-GEF FSP - MOROCCO: INTEGRATED
            SOLAR COMBINED CYCLE POWER PLANT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Integrated Solar Combined Cycle
            Power Project : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Solar Combined Cycle
            Power Project for Morocco aims at increasing the use of
            renewable energy sources in Morocco and to help reduce the
            long-term costs of low greenhouse gas emitting energy
            technologies. As a country that is well endowed with both
            solar and wind resources, this project will allow Morocco to
            develop this comparative advantage and become a leader in
            the application of solar thermal technologies. The
            environmental impact of the plant both at the local and
            regional/global level will be minimal as the plant will
            utilize solar and natural gas. The use of solar power does
            not produce any pollutants. The combustion of natural gas
            leads to the lowest level of CO2 emissions of any fossil
            fuel. In addition, the combustion of natural gas does not
            entail SO2 emissions, and has significantly lower emissions
            of NOx than other fossil fuels. The heat transfer oil used
            in the system might leak and contaminate soil. However,
            appropriate treatment of contaminated soil has been included
            in the design of the project. No other adverse environmental
            impacts, including on groundwater, are foreseen. Equally, no
            resettlement is foreseen and no adverse social impacts are expected.

docna.cdata!:
Rapport d'actualisation sur
            l'environnement de la centrale thermo-solaire
            d'Ain Beni Mathar

display_title.display_title:
The Integrated Solar Combined
            Cycle Power Project for Morocco aims at increasing the use
            of renewable energy sources in Morocco and to help reduce
            the long-term costs of low greenhouse gas emitting energy
            technologies. As a country that is well endowed with both
            solar and wind resources, this project will allow Morocco to
            develop this comparative advantage and become a leader in
            the application of solar thermal technologies. The
            environmental impact of the plant both at the local and
            regional/global level will be minimal as the plant will
            utilize solar and natural gas. The use of solar power does
            not produce any pollutants. The combustion of natural gas
            leads to the lowest level of CO2 emissions of any fossil
            fuel. In addition, the combustion of natural gas does not
            entail SO2 emissions, and has significantly lower emissions
            of NOx than other fossil fuels. The heat transfer oil used
            in the system might leak and contaminate soil. However,
            appropriate treatment of contaminated soil has been included
            in the design of the project. No other adverse environmental
            impacts, including on groundwater, are foreseen. Equally, no
            resettlement is foreseen and no adverse social impacts are
            expected. (Vol. 5) : Rapport d’actualisation sur
            l’environnement de la centrale thermosolaire d’Ain Beni Mathar

Maroc - Etude d'impact sur l

repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Integrated Solar Combined Cycle
            Power Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Integrated
            Solar Combined Cycle Power Project in Morocco is to add
            urgently needed capacity to the Moroccan power grid to help
            cope with the sustained growth in electricity demand, to
            increase the contribution of renewable energy sources in
            Morocco's energy mix which would reduce greenhouse gas
            emissions, and to contribute to a program of global
            environmental significance. The project includes the
            integration of a parabolic trough solar field with a
            traditional natural gas based power generating unit
            (combined cycle). The project involves the construction and
            operation of a solar/fossil hybrid power station of about
            472 MW, of which 452 MW2 from combined cycle gas turbine and
            20 MW from the solar component with an expected annual net
            production of 3,538 GWh per year. The solar output is
            estimated at 1.13 percent of the annual production
            representing 40 GWh per year. The project has nine basic
            components: design, construction and operation of an
            integrated solar combined cycle power plant; construction of
            transmission lines; construction of a substation;
            construction of access roads; drilling of boreholes; land
            acquisition; gas pipeline construction; environmental and
            social development management; and consulting services.

repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Integrated Solar Combined Cycle
            Power Project : resettlement policy framework

abstracts.cdata!:
This involuntary resettlement plan for
            the Integrated Solar Combined Cycle Power Project for
            Morocco expresses the objective to minimize the impact on
            people and habitations as well as environmentally sensitive
            areas while constructing necessary infrastructure to support
            the planned solar power station; identifies the persons,
            collectives, and businesses expected to be affected by
            project activities, and describes the legal basis and
            procedures for awarding them compensation.
